stream_context.summary: Kaze live-models and UV-maps the icy "fridge / castle" of Course 13, tests Sauraen’s new FBDX3 microcode on real hardware, and chats about upcoming demos and videos.

development_findings.summary: Integrated Sauraen’s FBDX3 RSP microcode; frame-rate now ~50 FPS and can probably reach 60 after further culling, but the game remains RSP-bottlenecked.
development_findings.quote: I finished this off-stream yesterday… we got FBDX3 working correctly now… it’s basically like 50 FPS now… I’m pretty sure we can get this to stable 60.

development_findings.summary: Per-area draw-distance exists and will be tuned to hide far-off enemies (grasshoppers, birds, bunnies) that still render and eat performance.
Current build runs out of memory for collision triangles; temporary fix is to mark surfaces untouchable until a proper collision map is generated.
development_findings.quote: We are running out of memory for collision triangles. It’s only temporary… as soon as we make a collision map, that issue will go away.

development_findings.summary: Bug: ambient light disappears when Mario approaches an additional light source under X2 microcode in emulator; works on hardware with X3; root cause unknown.
development_findings.quote: When I get close to an additional light source the ambient light just disappears… it works on X3, but the X2 version doesn’t.

development_findings.summary: Course 13 design: labyrinthine ice castle with secret pipe warps, multiple routes, outside area, and an 8-bit retro sub-area; two outside stars (8 red coins, hidden entrance).
Only two of five Yoshi coins (guns) implemented in Course 13; remaining three still pending.
Next public demo will feature only Course 1 to showcase the new camera and Mario controls; no date given.
development_findings.quote: I’m planning a demo of just Course 1… everyone can play with the new camera and the new Mario controls.

development_findings.summary: Kaze’s upcoming video lineup: Mario 64 optimisations, Course 1 demo, Banjo-Kazooie demo, re-evaluating memory vs RSP bottlenecks, and beta assets overview.

context_findings.summary: Kaze and Zeina recently had a child; he’s off regular work, needs higher income, and plans to release more YouTube content—even if it means ‘selling out’.
context_findings.quote: Now that I have a child, I need to make more money, so that means a lot more YouTube content… I might have to sell out a little bit.

context_findings.summary: Kaze’s visual philosophy: emotion first, aesthetics second; Course 13 should feel ‘cold and mysterious’, hence heavy use of blues.
context_findings.quote: When I’m doing visuals… I think about emotions I want to invoke in the player. I want this to feel cold and mysterious, so blue is good.

context_findings.summary: He has no traditional job; all income is online; uses Discord at work and Linux toolchain under Windows.
context_findings.quote: I don’t have an IRL job. All my jobs are online… It compiles the game for me.

context_findings.summary: Expresses frustration and humour over audience difficulty feedback—some call levels too hard, others too easy.
context_findings.quote: I get a lot of people saying this is too difficult, and then I get a lot of people saying this is too easy.

context_findings.summary: Parents will visit in two days, affecting stream schedule; Zeina will cut his hair to save money.
context_findings.quote: My parents are gonna be coming to visit in two days… I’m not paying for a haircut. I’m making Zeina do it.

biobak.summary: Will overhaul and polish textures after Kaze’s placeholders; Kaze treats his own work as a ‘suggestion’ Biobak will improve.
biobak.quote: Whatever I do is just kind of like a suggestion for Biobak and he’s gonna make it look a lot better.

zeina.summary: Currently modelling assets for Course 13’s outside area; two stars will rely on that section.
zeina.quote: We are planning on the outside area and Zeina is making it right now… Two stars are going to be related to the outside area.

zeina.summary: Handles personal tasks such as cutting Kaze’s hair; casual, supportive dynamic.
zeina.quote: I’m not paying for a haircut. I’m making Zeina do it.

key_stories.title: Switching to FBDX3 Microcode
key_stories.summary: Sauraen’s new FBDX3 microcode was integrated, immediately boosting Course 13’s frame-rate to ~50 FPS. Kaze demonstrates live and explains that RSP, not RDP, is now the main bottleneck.
key_stories.challenge: Course 13 dipped to 30 FPS and long-distance objects still rendered.
key_stories.process: Implemented FBDX3, measured RDP/RSP times, disabled far enemies, discussed per-area draw distance.
key_stories.outcome: Believes stable 60 FPS is achievable; new focus is on RSP optimisation and smarter culling.
key_stories.key_quote: Maybe the world is just not ready to move on from blaming the RDP… but one day they will optimise their RSP.

key_stories.title: Collision Memory Crisis
key_stories.summary: While testing, the level exceeded the engine’s collision-triangle memory limit, causing gameplay issues.
key_stories.challenge: Out-of-memory for collision data in Course 13.
key_stories.process: Marked certain geometry untouchable as a temporary workaround; plans to build a lighter collision map later.
key_stories.outcome: Issue parked; will be solved once collision map is rebuilt.
key_stories.key_quote: We are running out of memory for collision triangles… for now we’re just gonna have to make stuff untouchable.
